results.title: Out of Sight Peace of Mind
results.creator_credit: Brian Hill and A. Stuart Campbell
results.brief_description: Yachts, motor cruisers, fishing vessels and merchant ships that rely on HF radio will soon be covered by a new safety net; the Global Maritime Distress and Safety System, which will combine the latest satellite technology with a number of new HF communications frequencies. The system will be introduced in Australia on 1 July 1991, and it’s vital that offshore mariners become familiar with the changes and the new HF frequencies.

results.title: Out of sight [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg, Danny DeVito and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Steven Soderbergh, ‘Out of Sight’ has been adapted from the novel of the same name by Elmore Leonard. When Jack Foley (George Clooney) robs a bank, his car breaks down and he is sent to a Florida prison. His escape attempt is witnessed by Federal Marshall Karen Sisco (Jennifer Lopez) who, as a result, is kidnapped by Foley’s partner, Buddy Bragg (Ving Rhames). Despite being on opposite sides of the law, Foley and Sisco discover their attraction to each other and Sisco is faced with a moral dilemma as she questions whether or not to turn him in.

results.title: Out of sight
results.brief_description: A record of a small boy’s day, his observations and fantasies. It starts with his awakening, and follows him through fields and along the beach until his return home in the evening. The film ends where it began, in the boy’s bed.

results.title: Out of orbit
results.creator_credit: Jam Handy and Michigan State Board of Alcoholism
results.brief_description: A dramatised case study of the effect of an alcoholic in the family. A boy’s 12th birthday is twisted from a happy occasion to one of despair because his father is an alcoholic. Discusses alcoholism as an illness and suggests ways in which an alcoholic can be helped by clergy, physicians, social workers, public health nurses and the general public.

results.title: Out of darkness (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Al Wasserman and CBS Public Affairs
results.brief_description: A documentary report which shows step-by-step a woman’s recovery from a severe mental illness. Dr. William C. Menninger discusses the case; Dr. Louis Chalden is shown actually treating the patient.

results.title: Out of darkness (A)
results.brief_description: Robyn Williams narrates this history of the Aborigines in Australia and the archaeological discoveries that have pieced together this history. Until the 1960’s it was thought that the Aborigines had only been here 10,000 years, but discoveries made since then have pushed this timespan as far back as 50,000 years. The predecessors of the modern Aborigines had a sophisticated culture during the ice age, making Aboriginal culture the longest surviving culture in the world.

results.title: Out of darkness
results.creator_credit: David Rittey, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A young girl, Alice (Isabella Giovinazzo), struggles to understand her father’s blindness resulting from an accident and blames herself. Fascinated by the universe, she imagines and wonders about her place in the world but feels connected and a part of the universe, a metaphor for her changing (but growing) understanding. Written and directed by David Rittey.

results.title: Out of breath
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
